text: Ongoing complaints about the Photos app redesign in iOS 18 persist, with users who are frustrated with how difficult it can be to locate certain images or photos that once were easy for them to find. For example, if you take a lot of screenshots on your iPhone you might want quick and easy access to them, and find the new Photos interface to be confusing. While there are a few helpful tips for fixing the iOS 18 Photos app redesign and sorting Photos by Recently Added again helps quite a bit, you might still be wondering where certain Media Types are located, like Screenshots. We’re going to show you how to quickly locate Screenshots on iOS 18 Photos app for your iPhone or iPad. How to Find Screenshots Album in Photos for iOS 18 Open the Photos app as usual Scroll all the way to the bottom, then tap on “Media Types” Scroll down in the Media Types list and tap on “Screenshots” Here are all screenshots stored on your iPhone or iPad This is how you can easily find your Screenshots in the latest Photos app for iPhone and iPad. The new Media Types section being a subsection of Photos app has certainly caused some confusion and frustration, but get familiar with this process now since it seems like the redesign is here to stay. Yes it’s additional steps and more confusing and hidden than the earlier versions of the Photos app, but Apple made this user interface change, and while it’s not necessarily popular with everyone, once you understand how to use it, it certainly will help you find your screenshots faster. Another helpful tip for improving Photos app is to sort by Recently Added so that if you take a screenshot it will appear at the bottom of your Camera Roll in Photos app as expected. What do you think of finding Screenshots in Photos app on iPhone and iPad with iOS 18? Do you like the new Media Types subsection, or do you wish they were easier to find like before? html:
Ongoing complaints about the Photos app redesign in iOS 18 persist, with users who are frustrated with how difficult it can be to locate certain images or photos that once were easy for them to find. For example, if you take a lot of screenshots on your iPhone you might want quick and easy access to them, and find the new Photos interface to be confusing. While there are a few helpful tips for fixing the iOS 18 Photos app redesign and sorting Photos by Recently Added again helps quite a bit, you might still be wondering where certain Media Types are located, like Screenshots.

We’re going to show you how to quickly locate Screenshots on iOS 18 Photos app for your iPhone or iPad.

How to Find Screenshots Album in Photos for iOS 18

  1. Open the Photos app as usual
  2. Scroll all the way to the bottom, then tap on “Media Types”

  3. Scroll down in the Media Types list and tap on “Screenshots”

  4. Here are all screenshots stored on your iPhone or iPad

This is how you can easily find your Screenshots in the latest Photos app for iPhone and iPad.

The new Media Types section being a subsection of Photos app has certainly caused some confusion and frustration, but get familiar with this process now since it seems like the redesign is here to stay.

Yes it’s additional steps and more confusing and hidden than the earlier versions of the Photos app, but Apple made this user interface change, and while it’s not necessarily popular with everyone, once you understand how to use it, it certainly will help you find your screenshots faster.

Another helpful tip for improving Photos app is to sort by Recently Added so that if you take a screenshot it will appear at the bottom of your Camera Roll in Photos app as expected.

What do you think of finding Screenshots in Photos app on iPhone and iPad with iOS 18? Do you like the new Media Types subsection, or do you wish they were easier to find like before? Share your thoughts and experiences in the comments.
